meanings.definition: The visual quality of the out-of-focus areas in a photograph.
meanings.sent1: The bokeh in the picture made the background look soft and dreamy.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often pay attention to the bokeh when capturing images.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the bokeh by jumping in and out of focus.
meanings.sent4: Her memories seemed to float in a bokeh of colors, blending and fading.
meanings.sent5: The bokeh of the sunset painted the sky in a beautiful haze of light.

meanings.definition: To blur the background in a photograph to create a bokeh effect.
meanings.sent1: She carefully bokehed the background to highlight the subject in the photo.
meanings.sent2: When you bokeh the background, it helps draw attention to the main object.
meanings.sent3: The photographer decided to bokeh the scene, turning the background into a soft blur.
meanings.sent4: His emotions bokehed the memories, making them appear distant and hazy.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes bokehed the colors, creating a mesmerizing effect.
